doc.previous: Alcids are superficially similar to penguins due to their black-and-white colors, their upright posture and some of their habits; however they are not closely related to penguins and are (with one extinct exception) able to fly. Auks live on the open sea, only deliberately coming ashore to breed.

Pigeons and doves are stout-bodied birds with short necks, and short slender bills with a fleshy cere.
